dataScience.Question: Point out the correct statement.
dataScience.OptionA: Raw data is original source of data
dataScience.OptionB: Preprocessed data is original source of data
dataScience.OptionC: Raw data is the data obtained after processing steps

dataScience.Question: Which of the following is performed by Data Scientist?
dataScience.Explanation: A data scientist is a job title for an employee or business intelligence (BI) consultant who excels at analyzing data, particularly large amounts of data.

dataScience.Question: Which of the following is the most important language for Data Science?
dataScience.Explanation: R is free software for statistical computing and analysis.

dataScience.Question: Point out the wrong statement.
dataScience.OptionA: Merging concerns combining datasets on the same observations to produce a result with more variables
dataScience.OptionB: Data visualization is the organization of information according to preset specifications
dataScience.OptionC: Subsetting can be used to select and exclude variables and observations
dataScience.Explanation: Data formatting is the organization of information according to preset specifications.

dataScience.Question: Which of the following approach should be used to ask Data Analysis question?
dataScience.OptionA: Find only one solution for particular problem
dataScience.OptionB: Find out the question which is to be answered
dataScience.OptionC: Find out answer from dataset without asking question
dataScience.Explanation: Data analysis has multiple facets and approaches.

dataScience.Question: Which of the following is one of the key data science skills?
dataScience.Explanation: Data visualization is the presentation of data in a pictorial or graphical format.

dataScience.OptionB: Willing to find answers on their own
dataScience.OptionC: Not Willing to find answers on their own
dataScience.Explanation: Hacker is an expert at programming and solving problems with a computer.

dataScience.Question: Which of the following operations are supported on Time Frames?
dataScience.Explanation: Operands can also appear in a reversed order.

dataScience.Question: Point out the correct statement.
dataScience.OptionA: Timedeltas are differences in times, expressed in difference units
dataScience.OptionB: You can construct a Timedelta scalar through various argument
dataScience.OptionC: DateOffsets cannot be used in construction
dataScience.Explanation: Timedeltas can be both positive and negative.

dataScience.Question: Numeric reduction operation for timedelta64[ns] will return _________ objects.
dataScience.Explanation: NaT are skipped during evaluation.

dataScience.Question: Which of the following scalars can be converted to other �frequencies� by as typing to a specific timedelta type?
dataScience.Explanation: These operations yield Series and propagate NaT -> nan.

dataScience.OptionB: You cannot pass a timedelta to get a particular value

dataScience.Explanation: Dividing or multiplying a timedelta64[ns] Series by an integer or integer Series yields another timedelta64[ns] dtypes Series.

dataScience.Question: Which of the following is used to generate an index with time delta?
dataScience.Explanation: Using TimedeltaIndex you can pass string-like, Timedelta, timedelta, or np.timedelta64 objects.

dataScience.Question: Which of the following principle is incorrectly represented in the below figure?
dataScience.Explanation: Principles of Analytical graphs are sequentially shown in the stepwise manner.

dataScience.Question: Point out the correct statement.
dataScience.OptionA: Least square is an estimation tool
dataScience.OptionB: Least square problems falls in to three categories
dataScience.OptionC: Compound least square is one of the category of least square
dataScience.Explanation: The Method of Least Squares is a procedure to determine the best fit line to data.

dataScience.Question: How many principles of analytical graphs exist?
dataScience.Explanation: Six Principles of Analytical Graphs are useful for data analysis.

dataScience.Question: Which of the following is not a step in data analysis?
dataScience.Explanation: EDA stands for Exploratory Data Analysis.

dataScience.Question: Point out the wrong statement.
dataScience.OptionA: Simple linear regression is equipped to handle more than one predictor
dataScience.OptionB: Compound linear regression is not equipped to handle more than one predictor
dataScience.OptionC: Linear regression consists of finding the best-fitting straight line through the points
dataScience.Explanation: Simple linear regression is equipped to handle more than one predictor.

dataScience.Question: Which of the following technique comes under practical machine learning?
dataScience.Explanation: Boosting is an approach to machine learning based on the idea of creating a highly accurate predictor.

dataScience.Question: Data Products shown in the below figure is built using which programming language?
dataScience.Explanation: Products mentioned in the figure are web application frameworks written in R.

dataScience.Question: Which of the following technique is also referred to as Bagging?
dataScience.Explanation: Bagging is used in statistical classification and regression.

dataScience.Question: Which of the following is characteristic of Raw Data?
dataScience.OptionC: Easy to use for data analysis
dataScience.Explanation: Raw data is data that has not been processed for use.

dataScience.Question: Which of the following CLI command can also be used to rename files?
dataScience.Explanation: mv stands for move.

dataScience.Question: Point out the correct statement.
dataScience.OptionA: CLI can help you to organize messages
dataScience.OptionB: CLI can help you to organize files and folders
dataScience.OptionC: Navigation of directory is possible using CLI
dataScience.Explanation: CLI stands for Command Line Interface.

dataScience.Question: Which of the following command allows you to change directory to one level above your parent directory?
dataScience.Explanation: cd stands for change directory.

dataScience.Question: Which of the following is not a CLI command?
dataScience.Explanation: rm can be used to remove files and directories.

dataScience.Question: Point out the wrong statement.
dataScience.OptionA: Command is the CLI command which does a specific task
dataScience.OptionB: There is one and only flag for every command in CLI
dataScience.OptionC: Flags are the options given to command for activating particular behaviour
dataScience.Explanation: Depending on the command, there can be zero or more flags and arguments.

dataScience.Question: Which of the following systems record changes to a file over time?
dataScience.Explanation: Version control is also known as revision control.

dataScience.Question: Which of the following is a revision control system?
dataScience.Explanation: Git is a free and open source distributed version control system designed to handle everything from small to very large projects with speed and efficiency.

dataScience.Question: Which of the following command line environment is used for interacting with Git?
dataScience.Explanation: Git for Windows provides a BASH emulation used to run Git from the command line.

dataScience.Question: Which of the following web hosting service use Git control system?
dataScience.Explanation: GitHub is a Web-based Git repository hosting service, which offers all of the distributed revision control and source code management (SCM) functionality of Git.

dataScience.Question: Which of the following adds all new files to local repository?
dataScience.Explanation: You should do this before committing.

dataScience.Question: Point out the correct statement.
dataScience.OptionA: You don�t need GitHub to use Git
dataScience.OptionB: CLI can help you to organize files and folders
dataScience.OptionC: Navigation of directory is possible using CLI
dataScience.Explanation: CLI stands for Command Line Interface.

dataScience.Question: Which of the following command updates tracking for files that are modified?
dataScience.Explanation: The git add command adds a change in the working directory to the staging area.

dataScience.Question: Which of the following command is used to give a message description?
dataScience.Explanation: This only updates your local repository.

dataScience.Question: Point out the wrong statement.
dataScience.OptionA: You need GitHub to use Git
dataScience.OptionB: GitHub allows you to share repositories with others
dataScience.OptionC: GitHub allows you to access others repositories
dataScience.Explanation: GitHub can store a remote copy of your repository.

dataScience.Question: Which of the following command allows you to update the repository?
dataScience.Explanation: The git branch command is your general-purpose branch administration tool.

dataScience.Question: Which of the following is the correct way of creating GitHub repository in to well labelled commits?
dataScience.Explanation: A fork is a copy of a repository.

dataScience.Question: Which of the following command is used to squash the commits?
dataScience.Explanation: In Git, there are two main ways to integrate changes from one branch into another: the merge and the rebase.

dataScience.Question: Which of the following statement would create branch named as �sanfoundry�?
dataScience.Explanation: A branch in Git is simply a lightweight movable pointer to one of these commits.

dataScience.Question: Which of the following term is appropriate to the below figure?
dataScience.Explanation: swer: b

dataScience.Question: Point out the correct statement.
dataScience.OptionA: Machine learning focuses on prediction, based on known properties learned from the training data
dataScience.OptionB: Data Cleaning focuses on prediction, based on known properties learned from the training data
dataScience.OptionC: Representing data in a form which both mere mortals can understand and get valuable insights is as much a science as much as it is art
dataScience.Explanation: Visualization is becoming a very important aspect.

dataScience.Question: Which of the following characteristic of big data is relatively more concerned to data science?
dataScience.Explanation: Big data enables organizations to store, manage, and manipulate vast amounts of disparate data at the right speed and at the right time.

dataScience.Question: Which of the following analytical capabilities are provided by information management company?
dataScience.Explanation: With stream computing, store less, analyze more and make better decisions faster.

dataScience.Question: Point out the wrong statement.
dataScience.OptionA: The big volume indeed represents Big Data
dataScience.OptionB: The data growth and social media explosion have changed how we look at the data
dataScience.OptionC: Big Data is just about lots of data
dataScience.Explanation: Big Data is actually a concept providing an opportunity to find new insight into your existing data as well guidelines to capture and analysis your future data.

dataScience.Question: Which of the following step is performed by data scientist after acquiring the data?
dataScience.Explanation: Data cleansing, data cleaning or data scrubbing is the process of detecting and correcting (or removing) corrupt or inaccurate records from a record set, table, or database.

dataScience.Question: Which of the following design term is perfectly applicable to the below figure?
dataScience.Explanation: Confounding can be dealt with either at the study design stage, or at the analysis stage.

dataScience.Question: Point out the correct statement.
dataScience.OptionA: If equations are known but the parameters are not, they may be inferred with data analysis
dataScience.OptionB: If equations are not known but the parameters are, they may be inferred with data analysis
dataScience.OptionC: If equations and parameter are not, they may be inferred with data analysis
dataScience.Explanation: Usually the random component of data is measurement error.

dataScience.Question: Which of the following is the top most important thing in data science?
dataScience.Explanation: The second most important is the data.

dataScience.Question: Which of the following approach should be used if you can�t fix the variable?
dataScience.Explanation: If you can�t fix the variable, stratify it.

dataScience.Question: Point out the wrong statement.
dataScience.OptionA: Randomized studies are not used to identify causation
dataScience.OptionB: Complication approached exist for inferring causation
dataScience.OptionC: Causal relationships may not apply to every individual
dataScience.Explanation: Randomized studies are usually used to identify causation.

dataScience.Question: Which of the following is a good way of performing experiments in data science?
dataScience.Explanation: Experiments on causal relationships investigate the effect of one or more variables on one or more outcome variables.

dataScience.Question: Which of the following is commonly referred to as �data fishing�?
dataScience.Explanation: Data dredging is sometimes referred to as �data fishing�.

dataScience.Question: Which of the following data mining technique is used to uncover patterns in data?
dataScience.Explanation: Data dredging, also called as data snooping, refers to the practice of misusing data mining techniques to show misleading scientific �research�.

DBMS.Question: What is the full form of DBMS?
DBMS.Explanation: DBMS is abbreviated as Database Management System. Database Management System stores the data and allows authorized users to manipulate and modify the data.

DBMS.Question: What is a database?
DBMS.OptionA: Organized collection of information that cannot be accessed, updated, and managed
DBMS.OptionB: Collection of data or information without organizing
DBMS.OptionC: Organized collection of data or information that can be accessed, updated, and managed
DBMS.OptionD: Organized collection of data that cannot be updated
DBMS.Explanation: It is defined as an organized collection of data or information for easy access, updating, and management in a computer.

DBMS.Question: What is DBMS?
DBMS.OptionA: DBMS is a collection of queries
DBMS.OptionD: DBMS stores, modifies and retrieves data
DBMS.Explanation: DBMS is nothing but a storehouse wherein the authorized user can create a database to store, modify or retrieve the organized data in the table. It can be modified or retrieved by users who have access to DBMS only.

DBMS.Question: Who created the first DBMS?
DBMS.Explanation: Charles Bachman along with his team invented the first DBMS known as Integrated Data Store (IDS).

DBMS.Question: Which type of data can be stored in the database?
DBMS.OptionC: Data in the form of audio or video
DBMS.Explanation: The reason for creating the database management system was to store large data and these data can be of any form image, text, audio, or video files, etc. DBMS allows the users to store and access the data of any format.

DBMS.Question: In which of the following formats data is stored in the database management system?
DBMS.Explanation: The data is stored in a table format intended to manage the storage of data and manipulate stored data to generate information.

DBMS.Question: Which of the following is not a type of database?
DBMS.Explanation: Different types are:

DBMS.Question: Which of the following is not an example of DBMS?
DBMS.Explanation: MySQL, Microsoft Access, IBM DB2 are database management systems while Google is a search engine. MySQL is a Linux-based database management system, Microsoft Access is a tool that is a part of Microsoft Office used to store data, IBM DB2 is a database management system developed by IBM. Google�s Bigtable is the database that runs Google�s Internet search, Google Maps, YouTube, Gmail, and other products.

DBMS.Question: Which of the following is a feature of DBMS?
DBMS.OptionA: Minimum Duplication and Redundancy of Data
DBMS.Explanation: The important features of a database management system are:

DBMS.Question: Which of the following is a feature of the database?
DBMS.Explanation: The important features are:

DBMS.Question: Which of the following is not a function of the database?
DBMS.Explanation: It allows authorized users to update, store, manipulate, or access data. Since data is stored in table format it is easy to access the data and perform the required functions. It also removes duplicate and redundant data.

DBMS.Question: Which of the following is a function of the DBMS?
DBMS.Explanation: The purpose of creating DBMS was to store the data. The data stored in the database management system can be can accessed by multiple users if the access is provided. The data stored will be accurate and complete hence providing data integrity.

DBMS.Question: Which of the following is a component of the DBMS?
DBMS.Explanation: The components of DBMS are as follows:

DBMS.Question: Which of the following is known as a set of entities of the same type that share same properties, or attributes?
DBMS.Explanation: In the actual world, an entity is a distinct �thing� or �object� from all other objects. For example: Each employee of an organization is an entity.

DBMS.Question: What is information about data called?
DBMS.Explanation: Information about data is known as Metadata. Metadata describes the data in detail by providing additional information like type, length of the data, etc. Metadata helps the user to understand the data.

DBMS.Question: What does an RDBMS consist of?
DBMS.Explanation: It consists of a collection of tables i.e., the data is organized in tabular format. The columns of the relation are known as Fields and rows of the relation are known as fields. Constraints in a relation are known as Keys.

DBMS.Question: The values appearing in given attributes of any tuple in the referencing relation must likewise occur in specified attributes of at least one tuple in the referenced relation, according to _____________________ integrity constraint.
DBMS.Explanation: Consider 2 relations r1 and r2. r1 may include among its attributes the primary key of relation r2. This attribute is called a foreign key from r1, referencing r2. The relation r1 is also called the referencing relation of the foreign key dependency, and r2 is called the referenced relation of the foreign key.

DBMS.Question: _____________ is a hardware component that is most important for the operation of a database management system.
DBMS.OptionB: High speed, large capacity disk to store data
DBMS.Explanation: Since all the data are stored in form of memory in the disk, a high speed, and large-capacity disk is required for the operation of the database management system.

DBMS.Question: The DBMS acts as an interface between ________________ and ________________ of an enterprise-class system.
DBMS.Explanation: A database management system is an application that acts as an interface between the user and the database. The user interacts with the application to access data.

DBMS.Question: The ability to query data, as well as insert, delete, and alter tuples, is offered by ____________
DBMS.Explanation: A query is a request for data or information. Relational Schema is the design and structure of the relation. DDL consists of commands that help in modifying. DML performs the change in the values of the relation.

DBMS.Question: ______________ is a set of one or more attributes taken collectively to uniquely identify a record.
DBMS.Explanation: Foreign key creates a relationship between two relations. Super key is the superset of all the keys in a relation. A candidate key is used to identify tuples in a relation.

DBMS.Question: Which command is used to remove a relation from an SQL?
DBMS.Explanation: Delete command is used to delete the existing record from the table. The drop table deletes the whole structure of the relation. Purge removes the table which cannot be obtained again.

DBMS.Question: Which of the following set should be associated with weak entity set for weak entity to be meaningful?
DBMS.Explanation: Every weak entity must be linked to an identifying entity; in other words, the existence of the weak entity set is contingent on the presence of the identifying entity set. The weak entity set that the identifying entity set identifies is said to be owned by the identifying entity set. Owner entity set is another name for it.

DBMS.Question: Which of the following command is correct to delete the values in the relation teaches?
DBMS.Explanation: To delete the entries from the table Delete from table command should be used.

DBMS.Question: Procedural language among the following is __________
DBMS.Explanation: Non-Procedural Languages are Domain relational calculus and Tuple relational calculus. Relational algebra is a procedural language that takes input in the form of relation and output generated is also a relation.

DBMS.Question: _________________ operations do not preserve non-matched tuples.
DBMS.Explanation: Left outer join returns all the rows from the table that is on the left side and matching rows on the right side of the join. Inner join returns all rows when there is at least one match in BOTH tables. Natural join returns the common columns from the tables being joined. A right outer join returns all the rows from the table that is on the right side and matching rows on the left side of the join.

DBMS.Question: Which forms have a relation that contains information about a single entity?
DBMS.Explanation: If and only if, for each of its non-trivial multivalued dependencies X 	woheadrightarrow Y, a table is in 4NF. X is a superkey�that is, X is either a candidate key or a superset thereof.

DBMS.Question: The top level of the hierarchy consists of ______ each of which can contain _____.
DBMS.Explanation: Schemas represent the logical configuration of the DBMS. Catalogs consist of metadata of the objects and system settings used.

DBMS.Question: _______ indicates the maximum number of entities that can be involved in a relationship.
DBMS.Explanation: The term cardinality refers to the uniqueness of data values included in a single column (attribute) of a table in SQL (Structured Query Language).

DBMS.Question: The user IDs can be added or removed using which of the following fixed roles?
DBMS.Explanation: Along with security, as the name suggests the db_accessadmin role also handles access. db_sysadmin refers to the system administrator. db_securityadmin as the name suggests it involves granting or declining permission to access the data ensuring security.

DBMS.Question: Why the following statement is erroneous?
DBMS.OptionD: a) Dept_id should not be used in group by clause
DBMS.Explanation: ) should not be selected

DBMS.Question: The traditional storage of data organized by the customer, stored in separate folders in filing cabinets is an example of ______________ type of �database� management system.
DBMS.Explanation: In an object-oriented database management system, the data is stored in the form of objects. In a relational DBMS, the data is stored in the form of tables. Hierarchy is obtained by Parent-Child Relationship. Parent-Child Relationship Type is basically a 1:N relationship.

DBMS.Question: After groups have been established, SQL applies predicates in the ___________ clause, allowing aggregate functions to be used.
DBMS.Explanation: The �with� clause was introduced to reduce the complexity of the queries which are lengthy. The �with� clause allows you to define a temporary relation whose definition is only visible to the query in which it appears.

DBMS.Question: Which of the following is not the utility of DBMS?
DBMS.OptionA: i) Backup          ii) Loading            iii) Process Organization      iv) File organization
DBMS.OptionB: a) i, ii, and iv only
DBMS.OptionC: b) i, ii and iii only
DBMS.OptionD: c) i, iii and iv only
DBMS.Explanation: swer: a

DBMS.Question: What does a foreign key combined with a primary key create?
DBMS.OptionA: Network model between the tables that connect them
DBMS.OptionB: Parent-Child relationship between the tables that connects them
DBMS.OptionC: One to many relationship between the tables that connects them
DBMS.Explanation: Using the two relationships mother and father gives us a record of a child�s mother, even if we don�t know who the father is; if the ternary connection parent is used, a null value is necessary. In this scenario, binary relationship sets are preferred.

DBMS.Question: Which of the following is correct according to the technology deployed by DBMS?
DBMS.OptionA: Pointers are used to maintain transactional integrity and consistency
DBMS.OptionB: Cursors are used to maintain transactional integrity and consistency
DBMS.OptionC: Locks are used to maintain transactional integrity and consistency
DBMS.OptionD: Triggers are used to maintain transactional integrity and consistency
DBMS.Explanation: Pointers are used to access data with great speed and accuracy. Consistency is maintained using locks.

DBMS.Question: Which of the following is correct regarding the file produced by a spreadsheet?
DBMS.OptionA: can be used as it is by the DBMS
DBMS.OptionB: stored on disk in an ASCII text format
DBMS.Explanation: For updating the value in ASCII text format, a regular text file is used.

DBMS.Question: What is the function of the following command?
DBMS.OptionD: c) Deletes particular tuple from relation
DBMS.Explanation: nswer: c

DBMS.Question: ______ resembles Create view.
DBMS.Explanation: The �create table� as� statement is similar to the �create view� as� statement in that both are defined with queries. The main distinction is that table contents are set when the table is built, whereas view contents always reflect the current query result.

DBMS.Question: The query specifying the SQL view is said to be updatable if it meets which of the following conditions?
DBMS.OptionA: select clause contains relation attribute names but not have expressions, aggregates, or distinct specification
DBMS.OptionC: query does not have group by or having clause
DBMS.Explanation: To update the view in sql all the conditions must be satisfied.

DBMS.Question: When the �ROLLUP� operator for expression or columns within a �GROUP BY� clause is used?
DBMS.OptionA: Find the groups that make up the subtotal in a row
DBMS.OptionB: Create group-wise grand totals for the groups indicated in a GROUP BY clause
DBMS.OptionC: Group expressions or columns specified in a GROUP BY clause in one direction, from right to left, for computing the subtotals
DBMS.OptionD: To produce a cross-tabular report for computing subtotals by grouping phrases or columns given within a GROUP BY clause in all available directions
DBMS.Explanation: A view can be thought of as a virtual table that gets its data from one or more table columns.

DBMS.Question: Which of the following is the best way to represent the attributes in a large db?
DBMS.Explanation: Concatenation in DBMS is used to join two or more table fields of the same table or different tables. Example inst sec and student sec.

DBMS.Question: Which of the following is the subset of SQL commands used to manipulate Oracle Structures, including tables?
DBMS.Explanation: DDLs are used to define schema and table characters and consist of commands that help in modifying. DML performs the change in the values of the relation.

DBMS.Question: Which of the following functions construct histograms and use buckets for ranking?
DBMS.Explanation: ntile(n) returns the number of the bucket in which each tuple is stored, with bucket numbers beginning with 1.

DBMS.Question: __________ command is used in SQL to issue multiple CREATE TABLE, CREATE VIEW and GRANT statements in a single transaction.
DBMS.Explanation: A schema is a description of a system�s structure in a formal language supported by the database management system, and it refers to data organization as a blueprint for how a db is built.

DBMS.Question: Which of the following key is required in to handle the data when the encryption is applied to the data so that the unauthorised user cannot access the data?
DBMS.Explanation: The encryption key is used to encrypt the message. Even if the message is intercepted by an enemy, the enemy will be unable to decrypt and interpret the message because he lacks the key.

DBMS.Question: Which of the following is known as the process of viewing cross-tab with a fixed value of one attribute?
DBMS.Explanation: Slice procedure takes one dimension from a cube and turns it into a new sub-cube. Dice takes two or more dimensions from a cube and creates a new sub-cube from them.

DBMS.Question: For designing a normal RDBMS which of the following normal form is considered adequate?
DBMS.Explanation: Because most 3NF tables are free of insertion, update, and deletion anomalies, an RDBMS table is sometimes regarded as �normalized� if it is in the Third Normal Form.

DBMS.Question: Which of the following is popular for applications such as storage of log files in a database management system since it offers the best write performance?
DBMS.Explanation: RAID level 0 refers to data stripping. RAID level 1 refers to disk mirroring with block striping. RAID level 2 refers to bit-level stripping and RAID level 3 refers to byte-level striping with dedicated parity.

DBMS.Question: Which of the following represents a query in the tuple relational calculus?
DBMS.Explanation: A nonprocedural query language is the tuple relational calculus. It specifies the needed information but does not provide a detailed strategy for obtaining it.

DBMS.Question: The oldest DB model is _______________
DBMS.Explanation: Network model has data stored in a hierarchical network flow. In a relational DBMS, the data is stored in the form of tables. Hierarchy is obtained by Parent-Child Relationship

DBMS.Question: Evaluate the statements issued by the DBA in the given sequence if OE and SCOTT are the users and the ORDERS table is owned by OE.
DBMS.OptionB: GRANT SELECT, INSERT ON oe. orders TO r1;
DBMS.OptionD: GRANT SELECT ON oe. orders TO scott;
DBMS.Explanation: the outcome after executing the statements?

DBMS.Question: Which of the following establishes a top-to-bottom relationship among the items?
DBMS.Explanation: A data model in which the data is structured into a tree-like structure is known as a hierarchical model. The structure allows information to be represented using parent-child relationships.

DBMS.Question: A major goal of the db system is to minimize the number of block transfers between the disk and memory. Which of the following helps in achieving this goal?
DBMS.Explanation: Every block has a copy on disc, however, the copy on the disc may be an earlier version of the block than the version in the buffer.

DBMS.Question: What happens if a piece of data is stored in two places in the db?
DBMS.OptionA: Storage space is wasted & Changing the data in one spot will cause data inconsistency
DBMS.OptionB: In can be more easily accessed
DBMS.OptionC: Changing the data in one spot will cause data inconsistency
DBMS.Explanation: One of the main features of a database management system is minimum data duplication and redundancy. Hence, is always consistent and so there is no duplication.

DBMS.Question: The logical design, and the snapshot of the data at a given instant in time is known as?
DBMS.Explanation: Instance is an instance of time, the relation is also known as table consists of data with similar characteristics, Domain is the collection of values that an attribute can contain and schema is a representation.

computerGraphics.Question: Which of the following statements define Computer Graphics?
computerGraphics.Explanation: Computer Graphics refers to designing or generating images using computers.

computerGraphics.Question: Among the given scientists/inventor who is known as the father of Computer Graphics?
computerGraphics.Explanation: Ivan Sutherland is considered the father of Computer Graphics. He is the inventor of an interactive graphics system called sketchpad in 1963.

computerGraphics.Question: Explanation: Ivan Sutherland is considered the father of Computer Graphics. He is the inventor of an interactive graphics system called sketchpad in 1963.
computerGraphics.OptionA: 3. Which of the following are the features of Computer Graphics?
computerGraphics.OptionB: a) Creation and deletion of images by computer only
computerGraphics.OptionC: b) Deletion and manipulation of graphical images by computer
computerGraphics.OptionD: c) Creation and manipulation of graphics by computer
computerGraphics.Explanation: swer: c

computerGraphics.Question: Which of the following is a Computer Graphics type?
computerGraphics.Explanation: Vector graphics are computer-rendered visual art that follows a mathematical formula. Raster images are made up of thousands of tiny pixels, making them resolution-dependent and ideally suited for photo editing.

computerGraphics.Question: Which of the following plane is used for 2D transformations?
computerGraphics.Explanation: A two-dimensional plane is used for 2D transformations. Transformations are useful for modifying an object�s position, size, orientation, and shape, among other things.

computerGraphics.Question: Which of the following is a Computer Graphics Curve?
computerGraphics.Explanation: A curve is made up of an unlimited number of points. Except for endpoints, each point has two neighbors. Explicit, implicit, Bezier and parametric curves are the three types of curves.

computerGraphics.Question: Who is the first user of computer graphics?
computerGraphics.Explanation: In 1960s William Fetter used computer graphics to create cockpit drawing. He along with Verne Hudson did research on computer graphics.

computerGraphics.Question: Which of the following is the purpose for using clipping in computer graphics?
computerGraphics.Explanation: Clipping is a technique for removing objects, lines, and line segments that are outside of the viewing pane. Several types of clippings are used in computer graphics like:

computerGraphics.Question: In a graphical system, an array of pixels in the picture are stored in which of the following locations?
computerGraphics.Explanation: The main purpose of using a framer buffer is to store pixels.

computerGraphics.Question: Curves in computer graphics is primarily used for which of the following function?
computerGraphics.OptionA: To draw different types of objects onto the screen
computerGraphics.Explanation: We frequently need to draw several types of things onto the screen in computer graphics. Objects are not always flat, and we must draw curves many times in order to draw an object.

computerGraphics.Question: __________ types of translation are present in computer graphics.
computerGraphics.Explanation: There are three types of translation techniques in computer graphics: point translation (which deals with a single point), line translation (which deals with a line), and polygon translation (which deals with a polygon) (deals with a shape).

computerGraphics.Question: Bitmap is a collection of ____________ that describes an image.
computerGraphics.Explanation: A bitmap is a set of pixels that make up an image. It�s a sort of computer graphics that lets you store and show photographs on your computer.

computerGraphics.Question: Which of the following devices provides positional information to the graphics system?
computerGraphics.OptionB: Both Input devices and Pointing devices
computerGraphics.Explanation: Input devices provide positional information to the system they are often called pointing devices.

computerGraphics.Question: Which of the following is defined as the number of pixels stored in the frame buffer of a graphics system?
computerGraphics.Explanation: The Resolution is defined as the number of pixels.

computerGraphics.Question: Which of the following is a primary output device of a graphics system?
computerGraphics.Explanation: The video monitor is the commonly used output device since it displays the images on the screen.

computerGraphics.Question: Which of the following is used in graphics workstations as input devices to accept voice commands?
computerGraphics.Explanation: Speech recognizers allow users to issue voice commands.

computerGraphics.Question: What is the use of voice system input?
computerGraphics.OptionB: To initiate graphics operation and also to enter data
computerGraphics.Explanation: The voice system input is utilized to start graphics operations or to enter data.

computerGraphics.Question: Which of the following is defined as the process of elimination of parts of a scene outside a window or a viewport?
computerGraphics.Explanation: Clipping is the process of removing excess content from a project. Clipping is a way of selectively enabling or disabling rendering activities within a defined region of interest in computer graphics.

computerGraphics.Question: Which of the following is known as the window opened on the raster graphics screen in which the image will be displayed?
computerGraphics.Explanation: In layman�s terms, it�s referred to as a graphical user interface (GUI). Users can interact with electronic equipment by using graphical icons and visual indicators like secondary notation.

computerGraphics.Question: Which of the following operations can be used to zoom in or out around any axis on a three-dimensional object from its original position?
computerGraphics.Explanation: Scaling is the process of changing or modifying the size of objects in computer graphics. The object�s size can be increased or decreased via scaling.

computerGraphics.Question: Among the following process, which process is known as the elimination of parts of a scene outside a window or a viewport?
computerGraphics.Explanation: Clipping is the process of removing excess content from a project. Clipping is a way of selectively enabling or disabling rendering activities within a defined region of interest in computer graphics.

computerGraphics.Question: Viewing transformation is the process of mapping a world window in World Coordinates to the Viewport.
computerGraphics.OptionD: Explanation: The viewing transformation is a computer graphics procedure in which the maps represent the perspective view of an object in world coordinates into the display space of a physical device.

computerGraphics.Question: Which of the following is defined as the drawing of number of copies of the same image in rows and columns across the interface window so that they cover the entire window?
computerGraphics.Explanation: �Tilling� is the process of drawing several copies of the same image in rows and columns across the interface window until the entire window is covered. In computer graphics, the window remains static while the viewpoint is modified multiple times to accomplish tiling.

computerGraphics.Question: How many axes do 3D graphics consist of?
computerGraphics.Explanation: The x-axis, y-axis, and z-axis are the three axes that make up a three-dimensional graphic. The length, breadth, and height of a three-dimensional object are represented by these axes.

computerGraphics.Question: Which of the following is the most commonly used boundary representation for a 3-dimensional graphics object?
computerGraphics.Explanation: The most common border representation for a 3-D graphics item is a surface polygon. This surface polygon encloses the object�s inside. A set of polygons is maintained for a description of the object in this way of representation.

computerGraphics.Question: Which of the following is the process of digitizing a given picture definition into a set of pixel-intensity for storage in the frame buffer?
computerGraphics.Explanation: The digitization of a picture definition into a collection of pixel-intensity for storage in the frame buffer process is called scan conversion.

computerGraphics.Question: Which of the following is commonly known as frame buffer on a black and white system with one bit per pixel?
computerGraphics.Explanation: The bit map frame buffer is always 1 bit per pixel.

computerGraphics.Question: Which of the following algorithm is a faster method for calculating pixel positions?
computerGraphics.Explanation: The fastest method DDA for calculating pixel positions is a faster method.

computerGraphics.Question: If the boundary is specified in a single color, and if the algorithm proceeds pixel by pixel until the boundary color is encountered is known as ____
computerGraphics.Explanation: This algorithm proceeds outward pixel by pixel until the boundary color is encountered.

computerGraphics.Question: Which of the following defines a pixel mask?
computerGraphics.Explanation: Inter-span spacing can be specified in a pixel mask that contains digits 1 and 0.

computerGraphics.Question: What does an aspect ratio mean?
computerGraphics.OptionA: Ratio of vertical points to horizontal points
computerGraphics.OptionB: Ratio of vertical points to horizontal points and horizontal points to vertical points
computerGraphics.OptionD: Ratio of horizontal points to vertical points
computerGraphics.Explanation: The ratio of vertical points to horizontal points and horizontal points to vertical points is known as an aspect ratio.

computerGraphics.Question: Which of the following is a correct abbreviation of DDA algorithm?
computerGraphics.Explanation: DDA stands for the digital differential analyzer.

computerGraphics.Question: The Cohen-Sutherland algorithm divides the region into how many spaces?
computerGraphics.Explanation: The Cohen-Sutherland algorithm divides a two-dimensional space into 9 areas before determining the visible lines and sections of lines. The sections of interest are seen in the central region.

computerGraphics.Question: The Cohen Sutherland algorithm is more efficient than the Liang-Barsky algorithm.
computerGraphics.OptionD: Explanation: Because the Liang�Barsky clipping technique performs as much testing as feasible before computing line crossings, it is significantly more efficient than other algorithms.

computerGraphics.Question: Which of the following is used for 3D positioning and modeling, animation, and other application?
computerGraphics.Explanation: A space ball is a 3D positioning device.

computerGraphics.Question: Which of the following can be used to determine the position on the data tablet?
computerGraphics.OptionA: Either Signal strength or coded pulse
computerGraphics.Explanation: Either Signal strength or coded pulse determines the position on the data tablet.

computerGraphics.Question: Which of the following type of perspective projection is also called �Angular Perspective�?
computerGraphics.Explanation: �Angular Perspective� is another name for Two-Point. The two vanishing points on the line in a two-point perspective form an angle between them, which is why it is also known as angular perspective.

computerGraphics.Question: Which of the following type of perspective projection is used in drawings of railway lines?
computerGraphics.OptionD: Perspective projection is not used to draw railway lines
computerGraphics.Explanation: The One Point projection is commonly used to depict highways, railroad tracks, and buildings. Only one vanishing point on the horizon line is present in a One-Point perspective, which aids in the creation of railway tracks.

computerGraphics.Question: Which of the following representation represents a three-dimensional object?
computerGraphics.Explanation: An equation representation can be used to represent a three-dimensional entity. Three variables, x, y, and z, and four coefficients, A, B, C, and D, make up the equation for a three-dimensional object.

computerGraphics.Question: Which part of a picture is considered and saved in exterior clipping?
computerGraphics.OptionA: We don�t consider the picture in exterior clipping
computerGraphics.OptionB: Picture which is outside the view window
computerGraphics.OptionC: Picture which is inside the view window
computerGraphics.OptionD: Picture which is on the edges of the view window
computerGraphics.Explanation: The image beyond the view window is examined and preserved throughout the external cutting procedure. The portion of the image that is visible through the view window is discarded. The external clipping method is the polar opposite of the text and curve clipping methods.

computerGraphics.Question: Which of the following clipping process handles the clipping of strings?
computerGraphics.Explanation: Text Clipping is the technique that manages string clipping. It�s the method for determining which parts of the string should be kept depending on their position in the view window. Text Clippings come in a variety of forms, such as all or none character clipping, all or none string clipping, and so on.

computerGraphics.Question: Which of the following algorithm can be used to clip a polygon in 3D space?
computerGraphics.OptionB: Polygon in 3D space cannot be clipped
computerGraphics.Explanation: Weiler Atherton Method is a 2D algorithm that may also be utilised in 3D space. It is primarily utilised in 2D space, but with the help of Z-ordering, it can also be used in 3D space. The Greiner Hormann Clipping algorithm and the Vatti Clipping method only function in 2D space.

computerGraphics.Question: How is the line path on the polygon area for a 45% line?
computerGraphics.Explanation: Only if a line is 45 percent is the line path centered on the polygon region.

computerGraphics.Question: Which of the following is defined as the sampling of object characteristics at a high resolution and displaying the result at a lower resolution?
computerGraphics.Explanation: By computing intensities and combining findings to create pixel intensities, super-sampling is also known as Post-filtering.

computerGraphics.Question: Which of the following is the correct full form of the NLN line clipping algorithm?
computerGraphics.Explanation: The full form of the NLN clipping algorithm is the Nicholl-Lee-Nicholl algorithm. It is a fast method of clipping.

computerGraphics.Question: �Skala� is an example of which of the following type of clipping?
computerGraphics.Explanation: Skala is a clipping procedure that can be used to clip a line or a line segment against a rectangular window as well as a convex polygon. Its algorithm is based on duality and homogeneous coordinates.

computerGraphics.Question: Which of the following is not a type of area sampling?
computerGraphics.Explanation: Weighted and unweighted area sampling are two methods of area sampling that differ in terms of intensity proportionality. Unweighted area sampling is also known as anti-aliasing, but point sampling is not a sort of area sampling.

computerGraphics.Question: In which of the following method, fixed pattern of a line is used to generate characters?
computerGraphics.Explanation: A mixture of 24bit line segments is employed in the Starbust approach. It is a character generating method in which only 24 strokes are defined for character generation.

computerGraphics.Question: Which of the following stores the picture information as a charge distribution behind the phosphor-coated screen?
computerGraphics.Explanation: DVST saves the picture information behind the screen rather than updating it.

computerGraphics.Question: Which of the following device is designed to minimize the background sound?
computerGraphics.Explanation: The microphone is designed to minimize the background sound.

CAO.Question: What is computer architecture?
CAO.OptionA: set of categories and methods that specify the functioning, organisation, and implementation of computer systems
CAO.OptionB: set of principles and methods that specify the functioning, organisation, and implementation of computer systems
CAO.OptionC: set of functions and methods that specify the functioning, organisation, and implementation of computer systems
CAO.Explanation: A set of principles and methods that specify the functioning, organisation, and implementation of computer systems is known as computer architecture. A system�s architecture refers to its structure in terms of the system�s individually specified components and their interrelationships.

CAO.Question: What is computer organization?
CAO.OptionA: structure and behaviour of a computer system as observed by the user
CAO.OptionB: structure of a computer system as observed by the developer
CAO.OptionC: structure and behaviour of a computer system as observed by the developer
CAO.Explanation: The structure and behaviour of a computer system as observed by the user is the subject of computer organisation.

CAO.Question: Which of the following is a type of computer architecture?
CAO.Explanation: Below are the types of Computer Architecture:

CAO.Question: Which of the following is a type of architecture used in the computers nowadays?
CAO.Explanation: John von Neumann proposed this architecture. The architecture of today�s computers is based on von Neumann architecture. It is based on a few ideas.

CAO.Question: Which of the following is the subcategories of computer architecture?
CAO.Explanation: The three main subcategories of computer architecture are:

CAO.Question: Which of the architecture is power efficient?
CAO.Explanation: Hence the RISC architecture is followed in the design of mobile devices.

CAO.Question: What does CSA stands for?
CAO.Explanation: The CSA is used to speed up the addition of multiplicands.

CAO.Question: If an exception is raised and the succeeding instructions are executed completely, then the processor is said to have ______
CAO.Explanation: The processor since as executed the following instructions even though an exception was raised, hence the exception is treated as imprecise.

CAO.Question: To reduce the memory access time we generally make use of  ______
CAO.Explanation: The time required to access a part of the memory for data retrieval.

CAO.Question: The IA-32 system follows which of the following design?
CAO.Explanation: This system architecture is used to reduce the steps involved in execution by performing complex operations in one step.

CAO.Question: Which of the following architecture is suitable for a wide range of data types?
CAO.Explanation: IA-32 architecture is suitable for a wide range of data types.

CAO.Question: In IA-32 architecture along with the general flags, which of the following conditional flags are provided?
CAO.Explanation: These flags are basically used to check the system for exceptions.

CAO.Question: The VLIW architecture follows _____ approach to achieve parallelism.
CAO.Explanation: The MIMD stands for Multiple Instructions Multiple Data.

CAO.Question: What does VLIW stands for?
CAO.Explanation: It is the architecture designed to perform multiple operations in parallel.

CAO.Question: In CISC architecture most of the complex instructions are stored in _____
CAO.Explanation: In CISC architecture more emphasis is given on the instruction set and the instructions take over a cycle to complete.

CAO.Question: Both the CISC and RISC architectures have been developed to reduce the ______
CAO.Explanation: The semantic gap is the gap between the high level language and the low level language.

CAO.Question: ________ are the different type/s of generating control signals.
CAO.Explanation: The above is used to generate control signals in different types of system architectures.

CAO.Question: If the instruction Add R1, R2, R3 is executed in a system which is pipelined, then the value of S is (Where S is term of the Basic performance equation).
CAO.Explanation: The value will be much lower in case of multiple BUS organisation.

CAO.Question: The small extremely fast, RAM�s all called as ________
CAO.Explanation: Cache�s are extremely essential in single BUS organisation to achieve fast operation.

CAO.Question: For a given FINITE number of instructions to be executed, which architecture of the processor provides for a faster execution?
CAO.Explanation: In super-scalar architecture, the instructions are set in groups and they�re decoded and executed together reducing the amount of time required to process them.

CAO.Question: What is the full form of ISA?
CAO.Explanation: The ISA is an architectural standard developed by IBM for its PC�s.

CAO.Question: Which of the following is the fullform of CISC?
CAO.Explanation: The CISC machines are well adept at handling multiple BUS organisation.

CAO.Question: The reason for the cells to lose their state over time is ________
CAO.OptionC: Usage of capacitors to store the charge
CAO.Explanation: Since capacitors are used the charge dissipates over time.

CAO.Question: In order to read multiple bytes of a row at the same time, we make use of ______
CAO.Explanation: The latch makes it easy to ready multiple bytes of data of the same row simultaneously by just giving the consecutive column address.

CAO.Question: The difference in the address and data connection between DRAM�s and SDRAM�s is _______
CAO.OptionA: The requirement of more address lines in SDRAM�s
CAO.OptionB: The usage of a buffer in SDRAM�s
CAO.OptionC: The usage of more number of pins in SDRAM�s
CAO.Explanation: The SDRAM uses buffered storage of address and data.

CAO.Question: The chip can be disabled or cut off from an external connection using ______
CAO.Explanation: The chip gets enabled if the CS is set otherwise the chip gets disabled.

CAO.Question: The controller multiplexes the addresses after getting the _____ signal.
CAO.Explanation: The controller gets the request from the device needing the memory read or write operation and then it multiplexes the address.

CAO.Question: The data is transferred over the RAMBUS as _______
CAO.Explanation: By using voltage swings to transfer data, the transfer rate along with efficiency is improved.

CAO.Question: The memory devices which are similar to EEPROM but differ in the cost effectiveness is ______
CAO.Explanation: The flash memory functions similar to the EEPROM but is much cheaper.

CAO.Question: The flash memory modules designed to replace the functioning of a hard disk is ______
CAO.Explanation: The flash drives have been developed to provide faster operation but with lesser space.

CAO.Question: The drawback of building a large memory with DRAM is ______________
CAO.Explanation: The DRAM�s were used for large memory modules for a long time until a substitute was found.

CAO.Question: In a 4M-bit chip organisation has a total of 19 external connections, then it has _______ address if 8 data lines are there.
CAO.Explanation: To have 8 data lines and 19 external connections it has to have 9 address lines(i.e 512 x 8 organisation).

CAO.Question: What does ISO stands for?
CAO.Explanation: The ISO is yet another architectural standard, used to design systems.

CAO.Question: The bit used to signify that the cache location is updated is ________
CAO.Explanation: When the cache location is updated in order to signal to the processor this bit is used.

CAO.Question: During a write operation if the required block is not present in the cache then ______ occurs.
CAO.Explanation: This indicates that the operation has missed and it brings the required block into the cache.

CAO.Question: While using the direct mapping technique, in a 16 bit system the higher order 5 bits are used for ________
CAO.Explanation: The tag is used to identify the block mapped onto one particular cache block.

CAO.Question: The bit used to indicate whether the block was recently used or not is _______
CAO.Explanation: The dirty bit is used to show that the block was recently modified and for a replacement algorithm.

CAO.Question: The number successful accesses to memory stated as a fraction is called as _____
CAO.Explanation: The hit rate is an important factor in performance measurement.
